column4: is there a way to lock in what /dev/sdX a paticular drive gets?
You can but would have to override plugdev and make a fstab entry for it.
What exactly are you trying to accomplish?
I wan't to get my arrays back online after rebooting without having to mdadm --assemble /dev/md0 /dev/sda1 /dev/sdb1 /dev/sdc1 /dev/sde1 .. and then mount /dev/md0 /mnt/FastRaid5 .. each time
